From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the line for automatic baud rate detection (autobaud), use the **autobaud** command in line configuration mode. To disable automatic baud detection, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: In the following example, the auxiliary port is configured for autobaud detection:
ExtraInfo: The autobaud detection supports a range from 300 to 19200 baud. A line set for autobaud cannot be used for outgoing connections, nor can you set autobaud capability on a line using 19200 baud when the parity bit is set (because of hardware limitations).![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Automatic baud detection must be disabled by using the no autobaud command prior to setting the txspeed, rxspeed, or speed commands.---
